rows.title: Stage 1 Overview

block1_text.eng:
**Overview for Stage 1 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 1 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.block1_text:
**Overview for Stage 1 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 1 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.title: Playdate 1-1

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use Math Talk to point out and describe objects to your child. Talk about the properties of these objects.

**Storybook:** This has color words.

**Activities:** These involve the properties of things.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use Math Talk to point out and describe objects to your child. Talk about the properties of these objects.

**Storybook:** This has color words.

**Activities:** These involve the properties of things.

rows.title: Playdate 1-2

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Continue to use Math Talk to point out and describe objects to your child. 

**Storybook:** This looks at how clothes can be too big or too small

**Activities:** These practice shapes and descriptions.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Continue to use Math Talk to point out and describe objects to your child. 

**Storybook:** This looks at how clothes can be too big or too small

**Activities:** These practice shapes and descriptions.

rows.title: Playdate 1-3

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Describe all the math that is all around you everywhere you go. Use Math Talk to chat about it with your child.

**Storybook:** This talks about speed, colors, and small counting.

**Activities:** These involve descriptions of places and objects, and also the following of directions.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Describe all the math that is all around you everywhere you go. Use Math Talk to chat about it with your child.

**Storybook:** This talks about speed, colors, and small counting.

**Activities:** These involve descriptions of places and objects, and also the following of directions.

rows.title: Playdate 1-4

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Math is not just counting – math is also about properties and relationships. This should be brought out in your Math Talk. 

**Storybook:** The storybook talks about colors, shapes, and spatial relationships.

**Activities:** These involve properties of objects and how those properties can create patterns.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Math is not just counting – math is also about properties and relationships. This should be brought out in your Math Talk. 

**Storybook:** The storybook talks about colors, shapes, and spatial relationships.

**Activities:** These involve properties of objects and how those properties can create patterns.

rows.title: Playdate 1-5

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use counting in your Math Talk. Count everything you come across. 

**Storybook:** This involves counting and the ideas of one more and one less.

**Activities:** These involve quantities of objects and building with various shapes.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use counting in your Math Talk. Count everything you come across. 

**Storybook:** This involves counting and the ideas of one more and one less.

**Activities:** These involve quantities of objects and building with various shapes.

rows.title: Playdate 1-6

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Your Math Talk changes when your child is able to respond to your comments and questions.

**Storybook:** This counts up to 5 and uses relationship words, which you can now use to ask your child about what's going on in the story. 

**Activities:** These involve describing things and finding properties that make things similar or different.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Your Math Talk changes when your child is able to respond to your comments and questions.

**Storybook:** This counts up to 5 and uses relationship words, which you can now use to ask your child about what's going on in the story. 

**Activities:** These involve describing things and finding properties that make things similar or different.

rows.title: Playdate 1-7

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Continue to emphasize words that describe properties and relationships.

**Storybook:** This has relative sizes and shapes. 

**Activities:** These involve using properties to compare things and find patterns.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Continue to emphasize words that describe properties and relationships.

**Storybook:** This has relative sizes and shapes. 

**Activities:** These involve using properties to compare things and find patterns.

rows.title: Playdate 1-8

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** This is centered on what makes objects the same and different.

**Storybook:** This has shapes, colors, relationships, and counting up to 5.

**Activities:** These involve grouping things with the same property.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** This is centered on what makes objects the same and different.

**Storybook:** This has shapes, colors, relationships, and counting up to 5.

**Activities:** These involve grouping things with the same property.

rows.title: Playdate 1-9

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use properties of things to establish patterns. Patterns are central to mathematics.

**Storybook:** This talks about the daily feeding of hungry animals

**Activities:** These involve properties and finding patterns involving those properties.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use properties of things to establish patterns. Patterns are central to mathematics.

**Storybook:** This talks about the daily feeding of hungry animals

**Activities:** These involve properties and finding patterns involving those properties.

rows.title: Playdate 1-10

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Discuss basic shapes and emphasize their names and descriptions. 

**Storybook:** This has shapes on every page. 

**Activities:** These continue the ongoing discussions about properties and patterns.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Discuss basic shapes and emphasize their names and descriptions. 

**Storybook:** This has shapes on every page. 

**Activities:** These continue the ongoing discussions about properties and patterns.

rows.title: Stage 2 Overview

block1_text.eng:
**Overview for Stage 2 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 2 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.block1_text:
**Overview for Stage 2 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 2 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.title: Playdate 2-1

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Count up from 1, start at 0 sometimes. This is the basis of understanding quantities and helps with beginning addition and subtraction. 

**Storybook:** This has counting from 0 to 9. It also has smallest, biggest, one more, one less, and colors.

**Activities:** One activity introduces the idea of counterexamples. The other activity is a 2-person strategy game making triangles.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Count up from 1, start at 0 sometimes. This is the basis of understanding quantities and helps with beginning addition and subtraction. 

**Storybook:** This has counting from 0 to 9. It also has smallest, biggest, one more, one less, and colors.

**Activities:** One activity introduces the idea of counterexamples. The other activity is a 2-person strategy game making triangles.

rows.title: Playdate 2-2

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Count down to 1, ending at 0 sometimes. This deepens understanding of the number sequence. It also helps with subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has the numbers from 1 to 7. It also has color descriptions on every page.

**Activities:** These involve lots of counting and small quantities. One activity also has adding or subtracting of 1 and 2.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Count down to 1, ending at 0 sometimes. This deepens understanding of the number sequence. It also helps with subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has the numbers from 1 to 7. It also has color descriptions on every page.

**Activities:** These involve lots of counting and small quantities. One activity also has adding or subtracting of 1 and 2.

rows.title: Playdate 2-3

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Understand strategies for comparing small numbers and quantities.

**Storybook:** This has counting from 1 to 10; relationship words such as too big or too small; and spatial relationship words such as above and under.

**Activities:** These involve  discovering shapes for quantities and playing with the order of numbers

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Understand strategies for comparing small numbers and quantities.

**Storybook:** This has counting from 1 to 10; relationship words such as too big or too small; and spatial relationship words such as above and under.

**Activities:** These involve  discovering shapes for quantities and playing with the order of numbers

rows.title: Playdate 2-4

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** This introduces the idea of Counting On and how valuable it is for understanding quantities and laying a foundation for addition.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 12, colors, shapes, and patterns.

**Activities:** These involve the order of numbers and how numbers compare to each other.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** This introduces the idea of Counting On and how valuable it is for understanding quantities and laying a foundation for addition.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 12, colors, shapes, and patterns.

**Activities:** These involve the order of numbers and how numbers compare to each other.

rows.title: Playdate 2-5

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Develop further your child's understanding of shapes. Introduce more shapes and their names and properties. You can use counting now to discuss numbers of edges and corners.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes on every page.

**Activities:** These involve creating lots of geometric shapes.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Develop further your child's understanding of shapes. Introduce more shapes and their names and properties. You can use counting now to discuss numbers of edges and corners.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes on every page.

**Activities:** These involve creating lots of geometric shapes.

rows.title: Playdate 2-6

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Make a lot of use of "one more" and "one less" to help with the understanding of the number sequence as well as beginning an understanding of addition and subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 9, one more, one less, and many relationship words.

**Activities:** These involve the ordering of numbers and the use of a number line.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Make a lot of use of "one more" and "one less" to help with the understanding of the number sequence as well as beginning an understanding of addition and subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 9, one more, one less, and many relationship words.

**Activities:** These involve the ordering of numbers and the use of a number line.

rows.title: Playdate 2-7

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Enjoy adding of small numbers with totals up to 5.

**Storybook:** This has counting up to 6, with colors and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve very small counting and adding. For now, only use small sums (up to around 6)  for the Bonded Groups puzzles.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Enjoy adding of small numbers with totals up to 5.

**Storybook:** This has counting up to 6, with colors and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve very small counting and adding. For now, only use small sums (up to around 6)  for the Bonded Groups puzzles.

rows.title: Playdate 2-8

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Fingers are very useful for counting, adding, and subtracting. Show your child how to make good use of their fingers for numbers of 10 or less.

**Storybook:** This has counting up to 12, shapes, and comparing.

**Activities:** These involve a number line for counting, adding, and subtracting, and Bonded Groups for practicing adding. Keep the totals for Bonded Groups small (perhaps around 7 or so), and slowly let the totals get larger.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Fingers are very useful for counting, adding, and subtracting. Show your child how to make good use of their fingers for numbers of 10 or less.

**Storybook:** This has counting up to 12, shapes, and comparing.

**Activities:** These involve a number line for counting, adding, and subtracting, and Bonded Groups for practicing adding. Keep the totals for Bonded Groups small (perhaps around 7 or so), and slowly let the totals get larger.

rows.title: Playdate 2-9

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Have fun skip counting by 2's with your child. It's a fun and fast way to count that helps them see numbers in a new way.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting along with shapes and comparisons.

**Activities:** These involve number shapes (to practice pairing things up for skip counting) and making symmetric shapes.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Have fun skip counting by 2's with your child. It's a fun and fast way to count that helps them see numbers in a new way.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting along with shapes and comparisons.

**Activities:** These involve number shapes (to practice pairing things up for skip counting) and making symmetric shapes.

rows.title: Playdate 2-10

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Playfully find many different ways to count a group of objects. This helps with understanding quantities and that counting, adding, and subtracting can be playful.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and counting up to 14.

**Activities:** These involve putting quantities of things into different shapes as well as playing with making estimates for quantities.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Playfully find many different ways to count a group of objects. This helps with understanding quantities and that counting, adding, and subtracting can be playful.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and counting up to 14.

**Activities:** These involve putting quantities of things into different shapes as well as playing with making estimates for quantities.

rows.title: Stage 3 Overview

block1_text.eng:
**Overview for Stage 3 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 3 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.block1_text:
**Overview for Stage 3 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 3 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.title: Playdate 3-1

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice adding by using the idea of Counting On. The term  Counting On means that, if you count two groups, such as 4 and 3, you start your counting at 4 rather than 1.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes and groupings of objects.

**Activities:** These involve addition and subtraction. Use the "Numbered" version of Dots and Boxes with small numbers to practice addition.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice adding by using the idea of Counting On. The term  Counting On means that, if you count two groups, such as 4 and 3, you start your counting at 4 rather than 1.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes and groupings of objects.

**Activities:** These involve addition and subtraction. Use the "Numbered" version of Dots and Boxes with small numbers to practice addition.

rows.title: Playdate 3-2

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice subtracting by counting down from the larger number. Talk about how "take away" and "difference" are two good models for subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting, shapes, and comparisons.

**Activities:** These involve comparing, adding, and subtracting.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice subtracting by counting down from the larger number. Talk about how "take away" and "difference" are two good models for subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting, shapes, and comparisons.

**Activities:** These involve comparing, adding, and subtracting.

rows.title: Playdate 3-3

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice subtracting by counting up to find the difference. Reinforce that "take away" and "difference" are two good models for subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 10 and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve addition and some estimating of small quantities.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice subtracting by counting up to find the difference. Reinforce that "take away" and "difference" are two good models for subtraction.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 10 and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve addition and some estimating of small quantities.

rows.title: Playdate 3-4

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** The Part-Whole relationship, seeing something as made out of parts, is a significant developmental step for a child. Practice Number Bonds, which are groups of numbers that total to the same result, with your child. Practicing with Ten Frames is an important part of this.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 10, comparisons, and a discussion of problem solving.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with number bonds.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** The Part-Whole relationship, seeing something as made out of parts, is a significant developmental step for a child. Practice Number Bonds, which are groups of numbers that total to the same result, with your child. Practicing with Ten Frames is an important part of this.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 10, comparisons, and a discussion of problem solving.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with number bonds.

rows.title: Playdate 3-5

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Ten has a very important role for our numbers. Practice adding and subtracting 10. Also practice taking the numbers from 10 to 19 and breaking them up into 10 plus some ones – for example, that 14 is 10 plus 4 more.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes and counting with small numbers.

**Activities:** These involve comparing and ordering numbers up to 20.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Ten has a very important role for our numbers. Practice adding and subtracting 10. Also practice taking the numbers from 10 to 19 and breaking them up into 10 plus some ones – for example, that 14 is 10 plus 4 more.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes and counting with small numbers.

**Activities:** These involve comparing and ordering numbers up to 20.

rows.title: Playdate 3-6

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use Fact Families to emphasize the connection between addition and subtraction. This is a natural follow on to the last Playdate's focus on number bonds.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 12, colors, shapes, and patterns.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with number bonds and with addition and subtraction of small numbers.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use Fact Families to emphasize the connection between addition and subtraction. This is a natural follow on to the last Playdate's focus on number bonds.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 12, colors, shapes, and patterns.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with number bonds and with addition and subtraction of small numbers.

rows.title: Playdate 3-7

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Adding Twins, where you add a number to itself, are often enjoyable addition facts for a child to learn. Near Twins, where you add a number to the next number (such as 3 + 4), are often easy to learn after adding twins have been learned, and they help your child to see how adding facts can be connected.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting, adding twins, and counting to 14.

**Activities:** These involve adding practice and estimating using a number line.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Adding Twins, where you add a number to itself, are often enjoyable addition facts for a child to learn. Near Twins, where you add a number to the next number (such as 3 + 4), are often easy to learn after adding twins have been learned, and they help your child to see how adding facts can be connected.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting, adding twins, and counting to 14.

**Activities:** These involve adding practice and estimating using a number line.

rows.title: Playdate 3-8

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** After skip counting by 2's and doing adding twins, it is a great time to start doing doubling, multiplying by 2, halving, dividing by 2, splitting things into two equal parts, and looking at odd and even numbers. This is a lot of topics; however, they go together very naturally.

**Storybook:** This has lots of discussion of how to split something fairly among coorperating friends.

**Activities:** These involve doubling and taking halves.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** After skip counting by 2's and doing adding twins, it is a great time to start doing doubling, multiplying by 2, halving, dividing by 2, splitting things into two equal parts, and looking at odd and even numbers. This is a lot of topics; however, they go together very naturally.

**Storybook:** This has lots of discussion of how to split something fairly among coorperating friends.

**Activities:** These involve doubling and taking halves.

rows.title: Playdate 3-9

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Do lots of practice skip counting by 2's – do this practice up and down, and start it anywhere (not just at multiples of 2). When this becomes easy, practice with other skip count amounts such as 5 and 10. 

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve practice with addition and subtraction as well as seeing which numbers can be seen as groups of pairs.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Do lots of practice skip counting by 2's – do this practice up and down, and start it anywhere (not just at multiples of 2). When this becomes easy, practice with other skip count amounts such as 5 and 10. 

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve practice with addition and subtraction as well as seeing which numbers can be seen as groups of pairs.

rows.title: Playdate 3-10

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Play lots of strategy games with your child. Even games that don't involve numbers have a lot of math in them. They will develop important problem solving skills.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 10, comparisons, and a discussion of problem solving.

**Activities:** These involve lots of problem solving while playing strategy games.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Play lots of strategy games with your child. Even games that don't involve numbers have a lot of math in them. They will develop important problem solving skills.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 10, comparisons, and a discussion of problem solving.

**Activities:** These involve lots of problem solving while playing strategy games.

rows.title: Stage 4 Overview

block1_text.eng:
**Overview for Stage 4 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 4 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.block1_text:
**Overview for Stage 4 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 4 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have a suggested storybook and some math activities. However, here is a list of optional storybooks and math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.title: Playdate 4-1

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Count up and down to 100 with your child, paying particular attention to transitions at multiples of 10.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes, counting, and groupings of objects.

**Activities:** These involve ordering and comparing of numbers. Use numbers to 100 for I'm Thinking of a Number.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Count up and down to 100 with your child, paying particular attention to transitions at multiples of 10.

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes, counting, and groupings of objects.

**Activities:** These involve ordering and comparing of numbers. Use numbers to 100 for I'm Thinking of a Number.

rows.title: Playdate 4-2

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use Expanded Form and 2-digit place value to understand the value and meaning of numbers. Expanded Form is breaking a number into tens and ones, such as 43 is 40 + 3. Place value is understanding that 43 means 4 tens and 3 ones – the place a digit is in is what gives it its value. Use Expanded Form and place value to help compare numbers.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 20, descriptions, and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve ordering and comparing games.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use Expanded Form and 2-digit place value to understand the value and meaning of numbers. Expanded Form is breaking a number into tens and ones, such as 43 is 40 + 3. Place value is understanding that 43 means 4 tens and 3 ones – the place a digit is in is what gives it its value. Use Expanded Form and place value to help compare numbers.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 20, descriptions, and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve ordering and comparing games.

rows.title: Playdate 4-3

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use fingers and Counting On to make it easy to add a single-digit number to any number. Use Compensation to make some addition problems much easier.

**Storybook:** This has shapes, quantities, and speeds.

**Activities:** These involve lots of addition and subtraction, and some practice with number bonds.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use fingers and Counting On to make it easy to add a single-digit number to any number. Use Compensation to make some addition problems much easier.

**Storybook:** This has shapes, quantities, and speeds.

**Activities:** These involve lots of addition and subtraction, and some practice with number bonds.

rows.title: Playdate 4-4

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use fingers to make it easy to subtract a single-digit number from any number, or to subtract any two numbers whose difference is a single-digit number. 

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes and polygons (many-sided flat shapes).

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with addition and subtraction.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use fingers to make it easy to subtract a single-digit number from any number, or to subtract any two numbers whose difference is a single-digit number. 

**Storybook:** This has lots of shapes and polygons (many-sided flat shapes).

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with addition and subtraction.

rows.title: Playdate 4-5

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use compensation to make adding and subtracting a lot easier.

**Storybook:** This has counting of groups and lots of comparison words.

**Activities:** These involve adding and subtracting, as well as a little bit of probability.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use compensation to make adding and subtracting a lot easier.

**Storybook:** This has counting of groups and lots of comparison words.

**Activities:** These involve adding and subtracting, as well as a little bit of probability.

rows.title: Playdate 4-6

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use 10 as an intermediate stop to make mental arithmetic for adding and subtracting a lot easier, as well as reinforcing number relationships.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and number properties.

**Activities:** These involve adding, subtracting, and number bonds.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use 10 as an intermediate stop to make mental arithmetic for adding and subtracting a lot easier, as well as reinforcing number relationships.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and number properties.

**Activities:** These involve adding, subtracting, and number bonds.

rows.title: Playdate 4-7

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice skip counting by 2's, 5's, and 10's starting anywhere and going up and down. This helps a lot with addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Skip counting by 10's also helps with place value.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 14 and skip counting.

**Activities:** These involve place value and simple additions with two-digit numbers.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice skip counting by 2's, 5's, and 10's starting anywhere and going up and down. This helps a lot with addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Skip counting by 10's also helps with place value.

**Storybook:** This has counting to 14 and skip counting.

**Activities:** These involve place value and simple additions with two-digit numbers.

rows.title: Playdate 4-8

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use doubling and halving as a way to start using the words of multiplication and division without making a big deal about it.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve doubling, adding or subtracting single-digit numbers with double-digit numbers, and place value.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use doubling and halving as a way to start using the words of multiplication and division without making a big deal about it.

**Storybook:** This has skip counting and shapes.

**Activities:** These involve doubling, adding or subtracting single-digit numbers with double-digit numbers, and place value.

rows.title: Playdate 4-9

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Do mental multiplication with your child for any two numbers from 1 to 5. This is the beginning of mastering multiplication!

**Storybook:** This has skip counting, shapes, and colors.

**Activities:** These involve addition, subtraction, and multiplication. Number Scramble can now involve all three of these operations. War using multiplication should only use the cards from 1 to 5 until your child is comfortable with larger numbers.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Do mental multiplication with your child for any two numbers from 1 to 5. This is the beginning of mastering multiplication!

**Storybook:** This has skip counting, shapes, and colors.

**Activities:** These involve addition, subtraction, and multiplication. Number Scramble can now involve all three of these operations. War using multiplication should only use the cards from 1 to 5 until your child is comfortable with larger numbers.

rows.title: Playdate 4-10

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** This is a chance to take a deeper look at problem solving using strategy games. A strategy game is any game where the players have choices that can make the outcome of the game better or worse.

**Storybook:** This has counting, comparisons, and problem solving.

**Activities:** These involve addition and subtraction. Use the numbered version of Dots and Boxes and write in two-digit numbers if your child is ready for them.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** This is a chance to take a deeper look at problem solving using strategy games. A strategy game is any game where the players have choices that can make the outcome of the game better or worse.

**Storybook:** This has counting, comparisons, and problem solving.

**Activities:** These involve addition and subtraction. Use the numbered version of Dots and Boxes and write in two-digit numbers if your child is ready for them.

rows.title: Stage 5 Overview

block1_text.eng:
**Overview for Stage 5 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 5 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have some suggested math activities. However, here is a list of optional math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.block1_text:
**Overview for Stage 5 playdates**

The Math Learning Step for the introduction for Stage 5 gives an overview of the topics that are covered during this stage. 

The individual Playdates each have some suggested math activities. However, here is a list of optional math activities at this same level that you may want to mix into your playdates.

rows.title: Playdate 5-1

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Your child's numbers are going above 100, and their adding and subtracting involves two-digit numbers. Practice 2-digit and 3-digit expanded form and place value with them.

**Activities:** These involve two-digit addition and subtraction.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Your child's numbers are going above 100, and their adding and subtracting involves two-digit numbers. Practice 2-digit and 3-digit expanded form and place value with them.

**Activities:** These involve two-digit addition and subtraction.

rows.title: Playdate 5-2

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use expanded form to practice double-digit addition and subtraction.

**Activities:** These involve two-digit addition and subtraction.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use expanded form to practice double-digit addition and subtraction.

**Activities:** These involve two-digit addition and subtraction.

rows.title: Playdate 5-3

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice skip counting up and down by any skip amount starting at any number (not just multiples). This skip counting is great practice for all four of the operations.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with skip counting.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice skip counting up and down by any skip amount starting at any number (not just multiples). This skip counting is great practice for all four of the operations.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with skip counting.

rows.title: Playdate 5-4

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice mental multiplication using doubling for 2, 4, and 8. Practice mental multiplication by 5 and 10 because they are useful and easy.

**Activities:** These involve doubling and general multiplication practice.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practice mental multiplication using doubling for 2, 4, and 8. Practice mental multiplication by 5 and 10 because they are useful and easy.

**Activities:** These involve doubling and general multiplication practice.

rows.title: Playdate 5-5

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Use the idea of one more and one less to practice mental multiplication for multiplying by 3, 4, 6, 9, and 11. For example, multiplying by 6 is one more than multiplying by 5.

**Activities:** These involve lots of multiplication practice along with some mixed operation practice.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Use the idea of one more and one less to practice mental multiplication for multiplying by 3, 4, 6, 9, and 11. For example, multiplying by 6 is one more than multiplying by 5.

**Activities:** These involve lots of multiplication practice along with some mixed operation practice.

rows.title: Playdate 5-6

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** All the pieces are in place, and your child is ready to finish off the mastery of all single-digit multiplication!

**Activities:** These are repeated from the last Playdate and involve lots of multiplication practice along with some mixed operation practice.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** All the pieces are in place, and your child is ready to finish off the mastery of all single-digit multiplication!

**Activities:** These are repeated from the last Playdate and involve lots of multiplication practice along with some mixed operation practice.

rows.title: Playdate 5-7

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Now that your child is getting comfortable with multiplying and dividing, it's time to develop a sense of how numbers can evenly divide other numbers. This involves in learning and practice the words: factor, divisor, and multiple.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with factors and multiples.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Now that your child is getting comfortable with multiplying and dividing, it's time to develop a sense of how numbers can evenly divide other numbers. This involves in learning and practice the words: factor, divisor, and multiple.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with factors and multiples.

rows.title: Playdate 5-8

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Using multiplication, primes are the building blocks of numbers. Help your child develop a strong sense of prime factorizations. The new words for this Playdate are: prime, composite, unit, and power.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with multiplication and divisibility playing with Turning the Tables. Practice prime factorizations by using them when you play Beep.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Using multiplication, primes are the building blocks of numbers. Help your child develop a strong sense of prime factorizations. The new words for this Playdate are: prime, composite, unit, and power.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with multiplication and divisibility playing with Turning the Tables. Practice prime factorizations by using them when you play Beep.

rows.title: Playdate 5-9

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** Practicing with fact families is a good way to deepen your child's understanding of the interconnection between multiplication and division.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with multiplication and divisibility playing with Turning the Tables. Practice multiples by using them when you play Beep.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** Practicing with fact families is a good way to deepen your child's understanding of the interconnection between multiplication and division.

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with multiplication and divisibility playing with Turning the Tables. Practice multiples by using them when you play Beep.

rows.title: Playdate 5-10

block1_text.eng:
**Playdate Focus:** This is a quick first step at practicing division with and without remainders. 

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with multiplication and division.

rows.block1_text:
**Playdate Focus:** This is a quick first step at practicing division with and without remainders. 

**Activities:** These involve lots of practice with multiplication and division.
